text: Haw can I test is a macro exists?

elements.text: Haw can I test is a macro exists?

text: `isdefined(Module, Symbol("@foo"))` might be what you are looking for

text: Thanks, that is exactly what I was looking for

elements.text: Thanks, that is exactly what I was looking for

text:
And using the macro version, how do I specify a Symbol?
```julia> Base.@isdefined Symbol("@hello")
ERROR: LoadError: MethodError: no method matching var"@isdefined"(::LineNumberNode, ::Module, ::Expr)
Closest candidates are:
  var"@isdefined"(::LineNumberNode, ::Module, ::Symbol) at essentials.jl:139
in expression starting at none:1```

elements.text: And using the macro version, how do I specify a Symbol?

julia> Base.@isdefined Symbol("@hello")

text:
```julia> Base.@isdefined hello
false

julia> Base.@isdefined @hello
ERROR: LoadError: MethodError: no method matching var"@isdefined"(::LineNumberNode, ::Module, ::Expr)
Closest candidates are:
  var"@isdefined"(::LineNumberNode, ::Module, ::Symbol) at essentials.jl:139
in expression starting at none:1```

text: Could open an issue about allowing this though

text: Okay cool. I saw `var"@hello"` is not a "*_str" macro but actually evaluates at the parser level. I take it that is why it works in this case.

elements.text: is not a "*_str" macro but actually evaluates at the parser level. I take it that is why it works in this case.
